SENT.plain: The most important complications encountered by achondroplastic dwarfs are neurological problems related to a narrowed spinal canal

Stenosis of the spinal canal is secondary to abnormalities of endochondral ossification with premature synostosis of the ossification centres of the vertebral body and the posterior arch, resulting in thickening of the lamina, shortening of the pedicles, and reduced height of the vertebral bodies
Additional factors such as prolapsed intervertebral discs, osteophytes and progressive thoracolumbar kyphosis contribute to the narrowing of the spinal canal
Three achondroplastic dwarfs having spinal stenosis and spinal cord lesion representing typical clinical courses are described
